seo.title: Art and Artisans of Positano (shopping)
seo.description: Sandals, ceramics, prints — where to find quality and how to ship.

intro: Shop Positano's artisan scene without overpaying: sandals, ceramics, prints, and how to ship items home.

sections.title: Custom sandals
body: Watch cobblers handcraft leather sandals in 30 minutes; prices start around €80 for bespoke pairs.
Bring or trace your foot for remote orders later—many artisans ship worldwide once they have your measurements.

sections.title: Ceramics & art
body: Browse family-run ceramic studios for hand-painted tiles and tableware. Ask about lead-free glazes if you plan to serve food.
Local artists sell prints and watercolours along Via Cristoforo Colombo—tube packaging protects them for travel.

sections.title: Paying & shipping
body: Most shops accept cards but offer cash discounts. Keep ID handy for tax refund paperwork on purchases over €154.94.
Ship fragile pieces via insured courier (DHL/UPS) and ask for double boxing; rates start around €40 depending on weight.

tips: Photograph receipts and artisan details so you remember which studio crafted each item.
Pack bubble wrap if you plan to carry ceramics in your luggage—hostels often have spare padding from deliveries.

a: Yes. Many will emboss initials on sandals or customise ceramic colours with a few days' notice.

faqs.q: How do I claim a VAT refund?
a: Request a tax-free form at purchase, have it stamped at the airport or ferry port, and submit within three months for reimbursement.
